issue.title: [C++][Documentation] Link to generated Doxygen docs from main Sphinx TOC tree
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7835](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
per discussion on https://github.com/apache/arrow-site/pull/45

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17060919) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Our current approach is to incorporate Doxygen-collected docs into the Sphinx docs using Breathe. Do you mean to change the approach?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17060934) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Is the C++ API in Sphinx comprehensive?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17060940) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
We have to add things manually to it. The downside is that we often forget to. The upside is that internal details don't show up...

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17061006) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It seems like it might be less maintenance to just use Doxygen for the granular API docs (and be diligent about putting things in internal namespaces or adding exclusions to the Doxyfile), that way the API doc is reasonably guaranteed to be fresh

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17061039) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Perhaps. The main motivation originally was to enable easy hyperlinks to the API docs from the C++ prose docs. But that assumes we make a sustained effort to write API docs.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7835?focusedCommentId=17064922) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Right. I agree we should write more C++ prose docs. I'll remove this from any milestone for now, and we can probably close. People are free to generate Doxygen locally and look at it if they want
